result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keone N Sims

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:41 AM Defendant Keone N Sims in court.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn in court for Keone N Sims.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
20CM1216 is scheduled for trial on 10-27-22.
Defense is still working on discovery in case 22CM760.
Defense indicates 20CM1216 is still in trial status.
Atty was only recently appointed and is not prepared for trial next month.
Defense is requesting a new trial date.
BTC: New trial dates set, matters adjourned, 22CM760 to track along.
Defense would ask that the deft's appearance be waived for the status date.
BTC: Deft's appearance is waived for the Status date, matters adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim H.Y (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keone N Sims in court.  Attorney Claude-Allan Milhomme for Alexander Lee Hahn in court for Keone N Sims. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Matter is scheduled on Defense's Motion to modify bond.
Defense is requesting that the bond amount be reduced to a $250 cash bond or a signature bond.
State object to any modification.
Arguments made.
BTC: Modify bond to $1500 cash, all conditions remain, matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
